newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish July net currency reserves up to $22.12 bln.
newsitem.headline: Polish July net currency reserves up to $22.12 bln.

text.p: Polish net foreign currency reserves grew by $580 million in July to $22.12 billion and were $5.09 billion higher than a year ago, the National Bank of Poland said.
It said net reserves grew $1.69 billion in the January-July period compared to a $5.84 billion rise in the corresponding period of 1995.
POLISH RESERVES (bln dollars) JULY 96 JUNE 96 JULY 95
NOTE - Figures in billions of dollars. Official reserves are those held by the state. Net reserves mean the total amount of hard currencies in the whole banking system.
